intro: Mediocalcar bifolium, commonly known as the two-leaved sandwort, is a low-growing perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions. It features a rosette of fleshy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in dry environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in a cluster at the end of each stem. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hair, which reduces water loss. Mediocalcar bifolium is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and limited rainfall.
